item.description:
The Brattle is doing their annual pre-Valentine screening of romantic movies and two Audrey Hepburn classics are being featured.

Roman Holiday begins at 1, followed by Sabrina at 3:30. Please note which films you plan to attend when you RSVP.

Afterward, we'll head off to a local eatery for dinner and discussion.

Roman Holiday:

"Mr. Wyler and his associates have fashioned a natural, tender, and amusing yarn about the heiress to the throne of a mythical kingdom who is sick unto death of an unending schedule of speeches, greetings, and interviews attendant on her goodwill tour..." - A.H. Weiler, New York Times

"The film itself is a classic of romantic wish fulfillment, exactly the sort of beautiful lie that Hollywood specialized in." - Ty Burr

This was the first major film starring Audrey Hepburn, the film that made her a star, an Oscar winner and (for many) a cultural icon. Gregory Peck, however, is also great in his role as an American journalist who discovers a princess-in-hiding (played by Hepburn). This film has a 98% rating on Rotten Tomatoes.

Sabrina

"It is a story as light as a feather and as old as yesterday's news, as transparent as a society column item and as smug as a foreign-made car. But Mr. Wilder...has made it into a commentary as crisp as a screed in a smart magazine." - Bosley Crowther, New York Times

This Billy Wilder directed film (not the Harrison Ford rip-off) depicts a love triangle between a chauffeur's daughter and two wealthy brothers (played by Humphrey Bogart and William Holden). This film has a 93% rating on Rotten Tomatoes.
